    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SampleApp()
      This application makes sample API calls to the CHPL API: - shows how to make API calls using org.apache.http - shows how to parse the JSON response using com.google.gson.jsonparser

      • SampleApp

        public SampleApp()
        This application makes sample API calls to the CHPL API: - shows how to make API calls using org.apache.http - shows how to parse the JSON response using com.google.gson.jsonparser

      • getValidUserInput

        public java.lang.Integer getValidUserInput(java.util.Scanner scanner)
                                    throws java.io.IOException
        Returns a valid integer from the console
        Parameters:
        scanner - for input
        Returns:
        integer representing user input
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - for incorrect user console input

      • getToken

        public java.lang.String getToken()
        Example 1: a. Call the API /auth/authentication using HTTP POST to get a valid token (note: the authentication token is not necessary for many API calls, including /search) b. Parse JSON response using com.google.gson c. Return token as string Uses HTTP POST to call /auth/authenticate and get an authenticated token to be passed for future API calls that require an authenticated user. Uses the Properties from environment.properties to obtain username, password, and API-key Parses json response and returns the value of the token from the json
        Returns:
        String with the token

      • getSearchResult

        public java.lang.String getSearchResult()
        Example 2: Uses HTTP GET to obtain the JSON response as a string from the /search?searchTerm= API call
        Returns:
        String with the searchResult

      • getSearchResult_saveResultsInFile

        public void getSearchResult_saveResultsInFile()
        Example 3: a. call the API /search to get all Certified Product Details b. Save results to a .txt file Uses HTTP GET to obtain the JSON response from the /search?searchTerm= API call and save as a csv

      • getSearchOptions_usesAuthentication

        public void getSearchOptions_usesAuthentication(java.lang.String token)
        Example 4: a. Call the API /data/search_options using token for authentication. Note that authentication is not required for this API call. Uses HTTP GET to obtain the JSON response from the /data/search_options API call. Uses token for authentication
        Parameters:
        token - for use in API authentication calls

      • loadProperties

        public java.util.Properties loadProperties(java.lang.String filePathAndName)
        Utility method to load Properties from environment.properties file.
        Parameters:
        filePathAndName - location of environment.properties file
        Returns:
        Properties necessary for user credentials, API-key and API calls
